content: Oh hey EDM crafters welcome good to have
you with me today we're actually building a dragon throne
and the basis for my project is this dragon toy that I got this super cheap
dragon toy but this video is kind of more about other things than actually
just the throne itself one thing is I want to talk about using toys in your
crafts I also want to show you I did texture on a throne with a stone texture
with the sponge I want to talk about that too so and a couple things mixed in
with this as well as the really cool dragon throne so let's go to the table
I'll show you what I did hey guys here's what inspired me for
today's project this is just a cheap dragon toy I got at the dollar store now
it's not a very good model as far as like using it for a miniature in the
game it's pretty crude but don't underestimate the value of this kind of
stuff for your crafting you can really save your time during your crafting and
make you and make your objects just that little extra oomph that really makes it
cool once you paint it up it'll look great now this would be great for like a
stone dragon statue okay and that's partly what I used it for in the craft
yeah don't don't underestimate the value of toys um you know hit garage sales
that kind of thing you can get toys just dirt cheap they're practically giving
them away and that's a great place to get inspiration or stuff to craft I even
had someone on the craft paint the kueh Toa goddess eye kid kid thing I read a
surname boom admitted a Boop or whatever name is but he made her out of a Barbie
doll and with a lops with a lobster he had eaten and put lobster claws out and
stuff so it was really really cool so yeah don't underestimate the value of
this stuff so let's go to the table and I'll talk about how I used it
so before the dragon comes into it I had to construct the throne setup so I've
got the base which is couple pieces of cardboard on top of each other then I've
got the back I made two Thrones out of pieces of wood there's a block a wood
block then a flat piece of wood for the seat then I had some shaped pieces of
wood that I got the craft store and I use those for the back and then for the
arms I thought it'd be neat to use clothes pin that I cut off small they
were the small closed pins and I cut those off and I'll move to the next step
so here what I've got of guy I've got the throne assembled and I've cut pieces
off the dragon I cut off the head and I cut off the wings I still yet to apply
the arms but I'm going to do is I'm going to use some beads
there's elongated green beads to be the arm holders for the throne and then I've
got the teardrop shaped thing that will go on the back of the throne that'll be
the holder for the dragon hit so here we go here's the throne all
completed I think it looks really great now the next step is to paint it up so a
base paint up black with flat black spray paint and then I'm come back I'm
up before I show you I'm going to talk about how I painted it with a stone
texture I use the sponge technique which I've shown in another video but I want
to talk about it specifically for doing objects now use the sponging technique
on the throw and I want to talk a little bit about this now I've shown it on a
video where i sponge the tile but when you're doing objects you want to have a
smaller sponge so what I do is I usually take a sponge and cut it up okay and
I've damp this sponge it just has a little bit of water in it it's not
sopping wet and see the shape there it makes that easy to get in the crevices
of objects with that shape you can paint the gray on there and then get the
object so basically the for those of you don't know the basics of the technique
is I just take a flat brush and you can't just run it through the gray the
pewter gray but I like to just paint it on that gives a nice even texture on the
sponge right and then you can just stipple it
on there okay so let's see that texture there all right so now what I do is I
usually do the two-part technique I use the pewter gray and then I use a dolphin
gray for highlights okay so we'll let that dry for a minute
and then come back for the next step now that my Tudor gray is drying I'm going
to use my dolphin gray and put a coat of it on the sponge I'm just using the same
sponge all right so now I'll take the sponge and just kind of
and this will give a nice stone like texture okay so basically that's what I
did with the throne I just did except I just use this edge here to get on this
edge here to get in all the crevices of the throne so some of it you may not be
able to get into you may have to hand paint but that's the basic technique
with a sponge and this this is really great it's really fast and easy to do
stone like texture on objects hey guys there's our finished throne I think it
looks really great you can see how good that stone texture that the sponge
painting of the stone texture worked on there you can see the detail of the
beads you got the dragon parts look really cool like a stone as stone work
okay so I'll put that down there and then you can see here I've got the Lord
and Lady and so the scale and they can even go on the three now they're
standing up it's kind of goofy but they actually fit on the throne so you could
put them on the throne like that so there we go a really cool dragon throne
